title: Bow and Arrow

nouns: The practice or sport of shooting arrows with a bow.
The sport of shooting arrows with a bow
The art or sport of shooting with a bow.
Sports
Archery is the art, practice, or skill of propelling arrows with the use of a bow, from Latin arcus.
A weapon consisting of arrows and the bow to shoot them
Weapon
A weapon consisting of a bow and a supply of arrows, often kept in a quiver.
A weapon system that uses elasticity to propel arrows, its use is archery
The bow and arrow is a projectile weapon system that predates recorded history and is common to most cultures.
The person, in a team or among oarsmen, positioned nearest the bow.
One who shoots an arrow from a bow or a bolt from a crossbow.
A person who is expert in the use of a bow and arrow
Someone who shoots an arrow from a bow or a bolt from a crossbow.
Someone with a Sagittarius star sign.
Someone with a Sagittarius star sign
Sagittarius is the ninth astrological sign, which is associated with the constellation Sagittarius.
A Zodiac sign corresponding to the constellation
Astrological sign
An instrument of attack or defense in combat, as a gun, missile, or sword.
A weapon.
Any instrument or instrumentality used in fighting or hunting
An instrument of attack or defense in combat or hunting, e.g. most guns, missiles, or swords.
Instrument used to inflict damage or harm to living beings, structures, or systems
A weapon, arm, or armament is any device used in order to inflict damage or harm to living beings, structures, or systems.
Weapon, arm, or armament are terms for any device used to inflict damage or harm to living beings, structures, or systems.
Corresponding to the astrological sign
Constellation
A large zodiacal constellation in the southern hemisphere; between Scorpius and Capricornus
One of the twelve constellations of the zodiac.
Sagittarius is one of the constellations of the zodiac.
